title.justification: The title 'Application-Driven Innovation in Machine Learning' accurately captures the focus of the research described, which is on application-driven research in machine learning as opposed to methods-driven research.
title.quote: In this paper, we describe the paradigm of application-driven research in machine learning, contrasting it with the more standard paradigm of methods-driven research.

extractions.description: This paper presents and discusses the paradigm of application-driven machine learning (ADML) in contrast to methods-driven research, highlighting the benefits and challenges of ADML in advancing machine learning methods and its real-world applications. It also addresses systemic issues in review, hiring, and teaching that hinder ADML.

type.justification: The paper primarily discusses conceptual frameworks and paradigms in machine learning rather than conducting empirical experiments or studies.
type.quote: In this paper, we describe the paradigm of application-driven research in machine learning, contrasting it with the more standard paradigm of methods-driven research.

name.justification: The paper is centered around innovation in the field of machine learning, specifically discussing paradigms within ML research.
name.quote: We illustrate the benefits of application-driven machine learning and how this approach can productively synergize with methods-driven work.

name.justification: The paper specifically focuses on application-driven machine learning, contrasting it with methods-driven approaches.
name.quote: We illustrate the benefits of application-driven machine learning and how this approach can productively synergize with methods-driven work.

name.justification: The paper contrasts application-driven ML with methods-driven ML, making it a subfield of interest in this discussion.
name.quote: We frame the paradigm of application-driven ML (ADML) research, propose where it fits within the ML research landscape, and discuss why it is important not just to applications but to advancing ML methods.

name.justification: The paper provides examples of models arising from application-driven innovation, such as the Fourier Neural Operators.
name.quote: Fourier Neural Operators [23], originally developed to solve the differential equations governing fluid flow, have now been used in applications as diverse as climate data superresolution and materials property prediction [52, 37].

is_contributed.justification: The paper does not introduce Fourier Neural Operators as a contribution; it references existing work.
is_contributed.quote: Fourier Neural Operators [23], originally developed to solve the differential equations governing fluid flow, have now been used...

is_executed.justification: The paper does not execute any models; it focuses on discussing concepts and paradigms.
is_executed.quote: Paradoxically, while ADML research is problem-centric, this approach has not merely improved the performance of ML in specific use cases...

is_compared.justification: Fourier Neural Operators are mentioned in the context of discussing their application and impact compared to other models.
is_compared.quote: Fourier Neural Operators...have now been used in applications as diverse as climate data superresolution and materials property prediction.

referenced_paper_title.value: Fourier Neural Operator for parametric partial differential equations
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the title of the paper where Fourier Neural Operators were initially introduced.

name.justification: ImageNet is cited as an example of a well-established benchmark dataset within the paper.
name.quote: Many of the innovations celebrated within the ML community arise through experiments on well-established benchmarks such as ImageNet [9].

referenced_paper_title.value: ImageNet: A Large-Scale Hierarchical Image Database
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the title of the paper that introduced the ImageNet dataset.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Jia Deng, Wei Dong, Richard Socher, Li-Jia Li, Kai Li, and Li Fei-Fei. ImageNet: A large-scale hierarchical image database.

name.justification: MIMIC-CXR is mentioned as an example of an application-specific benchmark dataset.
name.quote: An increasing number of application-specific benchmarks, such as iNaturalist [47], ClimSim [53], WILDS [21], MIMIC-CXR [18], CityLearn [48], and Grid2Op [28], have been created...

referenced_paper_title.value: MIMIC-CXR, a de-identified publicly available database of chest radiographs with free-text reports
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the title of the paper that introduced the MIMIC-CXR dataset.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Alistair EW Johnson, Tom J Pollard, Seth J Berkowitz, Nathaniel R Greenbaum, Matthew P Lungren, Chih-ying Deng, Roger G Mark, and Steven Horng. MIMIC-CXR, a de-identified publicly available database of chest radiographs with free-text reports.

name.justification: OpenAI Gym is mentioned as an example of a tool used in methods-driven research for evaluating ML methods.
name.quote: Many of the innovations celebrated within the ML community arise through experiments on well-established benchmarks such as ImageNet [9], MS COCO [24], the OpenAI Gym [7], etc.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced material mentioned is likely the same title as the library itself due to the context given.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Greg Brockman, Vicki Cheung, Ludwig Pettersson, Jonas Schneider, John Schulman, Jie Tang, and Wojciech Zaremba. OpenAI gym. arXiv preprint arXiv:1606.01540, 2016.
